definition: to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: He al ays makes full preparations for his classes and corrects our home ork carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他總是認真備課，認真批改作業。

sentences.english: He always makes full preparations for his classes and corrects our homework carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他總是認真備課，認真批改作業。

sentences.english: Provide the FT with all materials required to prepare and teach lessons.
sentences.chinese: 爲外師提供備課和教課所需材料。

sentences.english: There're many computers in the lesson-preparing office.
sentences.chinese: 在我們備課室裏有許多電腦。

sentences.english: He often makes full preparations for his class and corrects our home ork carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他經常認真備課，認真爲我們批改作業。

sentences.english: To prepare lessons before class and organize interaction activities with parents and students.
sentences.chinese: 組織備課和與家長學生互動活動。

sentences.english: Between classes the Senior 1 English Office is a mad-house.
sentences.chinese: 課間高一英語備課組的辦公室熱鬧得掀開了鍋。

sentences.english: He often makes full preparations for his class and corrects our homework carefully.
sentences.chinese: 經常認真備課，認真們批改作業。

sentences.english: At the moment, Mr. Chen preparing for lesson worried about another problem.
sentences.chinese: 此時此刻，正在備課的陳老師擔憂着另外的問題。

sentences.english: And I will have three classes tomorrow morning. There is no enough time left for me.
sentences.chinese: 而明天早上我有三節課，剩下的時間不夠備課。

sentences.english: Night you are still seriously preparing lessons.
sentences.chinese: 深夜裏您還在認真地備課。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to a kind of printed matter-textbook with pages for preparing lessons.
sentences.chinese: 本發明涉及一種印刷品即帶備課頁的教本。

definition: to make up missed lesson/to reschedule a class
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to repeat a lesson/to learn by heart/to endorse a check
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to finish class/to get out of class
